div.l: I wote wel be þe Cradil I have mys go
Here lyth the Miller and his wyfe also
And forth he goith atwenty devilwey
To the bed ther͗e as the Miller lay
He went have crope by his felawe Iohn
And by the Miller he crepith in anon̄
He kaght hym be the nek and soft spak
He seid þowe Iohn thowe swynyshede a wake
For Cristis sale and here a nobil game
For by that lord that callid is seynt Iame
As I have thrijs in this short nyght
Swyvid the Millerys doghter bolt vp right
While thowe hast as a coward ben̄ agast
Ȝee fals M Cl harlot quod þe myller hast
A fals treytour͗e fals Clerk quod he
Thowe shalt be Dede be goddis dignite
Who dare be so bold to disꝑparage
My doghter that is com̄ of such lynage
And by the throte bol he caght Aleyn̄
And he hent hym̄ dispetously ageyn̄
And on the nose he smote hym with his fist
Doun̄ ran̄ the blode streme oppon̄ his brist
And in þe flore with mowith ⁊and nose to broke
They walowe as don̄ to pigges in a poke
And vp they goon̄ and down̄ ageyn̄ anon̄
Til that the Miller stombelid atta stone
And down̄ he fil bakward on his wyfe
That wist no thing of that nyse stryfe
For she was fal a slepe alitil white
With Iohn the Clerk that wakith hath al nyght
And with the fal out of her slepe she breyd
Help holy Croys of Bromham she seid
I manus tuas to the lord I cal
Awake Symond the fend is on vs fal
Myn̄ hert is brokyn̄ help I am but Dede
